0.text: Bug 21063  Can't drop views over some widgets.

1.text: Build GM5 - Linux/GTK  The GTK build of Eclipse does not seem to let you drop a view over top of a scroll bar or a table header.

2.text: 1) Start a fresh copy of Eclipse.

3.text: 2) From the resource perspective, drag the outline view over the Tasks view.

4.text: - Notice that when the mouse cursor is over the header for the table in the tasks view, the no drop cursor is shown.

5.text: Dropping the Outline view at this point will not reposition the view.

6.text: 3) If the navigator view does not have a horizontal scroll bar, create a project with a very long name so that the navigator does show a scroll bar.

7.text: 4) Drag the outline view from on top of the tasks view to the bottom of the navigator view.

8.text: - Notice that when the mouse cursor is over the horizontal scroll bar, the no drop cursor is shown.

9.text: - Notice also that the space on the screen where the dock below cursor is very small.

10.text: - Notice that even when the Dock below cursor is being shown that dropping the view does not always reposition the view.

11.text: This is not the behaviour that I have seen when using Motif, or when on Windows.
